result.execSummary:
The defendant John David Beaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $600.00 plus DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements. Bail to apply.  Balance to be taken from prison funds to be collected by DOC not to exceed 25%.  Any remaining balance to be paid while on Extended supervision.  Failure to pay would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment to extent possible.  Be given job and vocational training.

Parenting classes/counseling.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
AODA assessment and any treatment recommended.  Remain controlled substances and alcohol free.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide DNA sample unless previously provided.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms; further advised of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John David Beaver

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (34 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing NOVEMBER 7, 2014 received and filed.
Bail refund notice and Affidavit mailed to surety 11/18/2014. dj
/from Cornerstone Counseling dated 10/05/14, filed.
/(2), in support of defendant, received and filed.
/for Presentence Investigation Report, received and filed.
/from WCS, filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant John David Beaver in court with attorney John P. Carlson.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility. Defense counsel requested a presentence investigation; so ordered by the Court. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John David Beaver in court with attorney John P. Carlson.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties held meeting in chambers and advised the Court that this case will not proceed to trial.  Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date in September, as defendant is recovering from surgerey.  Court ordered all conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
WCS report received and filed.
/(2) submitted by defense counsel, received and filed.

Defendant John David Beaver in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moved to adjourn the jury trial scheduled for 6/18/14.  No objection by defense counsel.  Court granted State's motion and ordered the 6/18/14 jury trial date vacated.   Court ordered case rescheduled before Branch 20.  WCS report received; defendant compliant.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
WCS report received and filed; defendant compliant.
/to Adjourn, received and filed. rn
/from WCS, filed.

Defendant John David Beaver in court with attorney John P Carlson.  Kimberly D Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a trial date. Court set the following motion scheduled: movant to file by 5/17/14; response due by 6/02/14; reply due by 6/06/14.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists must be filed one week prior to the final pretrial date.  Any alibi notices must be filed according to statute.  WCS report received.  Defendant compliant.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John David Beaver in court with attorney John P. Carlson.  Defendant John David Beaver in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another scheduling date.  Court granted joint request and ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bali to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
WCS Report, received and filed. rn

Defendant John David Beaver in court with attorney John C. Carlson.  Kimberly Schoepp for appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defendant John David Beaver in court with attorney .  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

14RM015191  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 3/13/14

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  ALSO SCRAM.

Defendant John David Beaver in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant John David Beaver in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
